description: Expansion of theta_3(z)*theta_3(2z) + theta_2(z)*theta_2(2z) in powers of q^(1/4).
comments: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
links: M. Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of phi(x^4) * phi(x^8) + 4 * x^3 * psi(x^8) * psi(x^16) in powers of x where phi(), psi() are Ramanujan theta functions.G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (32 t)) = 32^(1/2) (t/i) f(t) where q = exp(2 pi i t). - _Michael Somos_, Mar 23 2012G.f.: Sum_{n,m} x^(3*(n^2 + m^2) + 2*n*m). - _Michael Somos_, Nov 20 2006 */a(4*n + 1) = a(4*n + 2) = a(8*n + 7) = 0. a(4*n) = A033715(n). a(8*n + 3) = 4 * A033761(n). - _Michael Somos_, Mar 23 2012
mathematica: terms = 105; max = Sqrt[terms] // Ceiling; s = Sum[x^(3*(n^2 + m^2) + 2*n*m), {n, -max, max}, {m, -max, max}]; CoefficientList[s, x][[1 ;; terms]] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Dec 03 2015, using 2nd g.f. *)
prog: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, n==0, qfrep( [3, 1; 1, 3], n)[n] * 2)} /* _Michael Somos_, Nov 20 2006 */(PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, n==0, if( n%4==1 || n%4==2, 0, 2 * sumdiv( n, d, kronecker( -2, d))))} /* _Michael Somos_, Mar 23 2012 */
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
